intro: Chrysosplenium pilosopetiolatum, commonly known as the silky-leaved chrysosplenium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Saxifragaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
